Judul: MLP Control Algorithm for Adaptable DualMode Single-Stage Solar PV System Tied to Three-Phase Voltage-Weak Distribution Grid
Abstrak: In this paper, an adaptable dual-mode single-stage  solar PV (Photovoltaic) tied to a three-phase voltage-weak distribution network is proposed using multilayer perceptron (MLP) neural network control structure. The system operates in dual modes: (1) It performs as a PV supplying active power with Distributed Static Compensator (DSTATCOM) capability thereby improving power quality simultaneously and (2) it works as a DSTATCOM alone during unavailability of the SPV generation. The system is adaptable as it continues to operate satisfactorily for voltage-weak distribution grid which has frequent voltage fluctuations and flickers. A single-stage converter based system is utilized here, which incorporates an incremental conductance (INC) based approach for MPPT (Maximum Power Point Tracking) and MLP neural network structure for the extraction of fundamental components of load currents. The main advantages of MLP are its simplicity, generic nature and ease of implementation. The system and the control algorithm are validated by using MATLAB based simulation results and test results are achieved on a laboratory prototype.
